item.title: Extra icanhazip services going offline

item.description: icanhazip.com lives on with the same mission, but with a new owner 🤗

item.title: Efficient emojis with rofimoji
item.description: Emojis brighten up any message or document. 🌻 Search, select, and use emojis quickly on Linux with rofimoji. 🤗

item.title: Changes in RHEL 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide Version 1, Release 3
item.description: The latest release of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) was published last week.

item.title: Fixing OpenStack noVNC consoles that ignore keyboard input
item.description: I opened up a noVNC console to a virtual machine today in my OpenStack cloud but found that the console wouldn’t take keyboard input.

item.title: OpenStack Summit Boston 2017 Recap
item.description: The OpenStack Summit wrapped up today in Boston and it was a great week!

item.title: RHEL 7 STIG v1 updates for openstack-ansible-security
item.description: DISA’s final release of the Red Hat Enterprise Linux (RHEL) 7 Security Technical Implementation Guide (STIG) came out a few weeks ago and it has plenty of improvements and changes.

item.title: What’s Happening in OpenStack-Ansible (WHOA) – September 2016
item.description: Welcome to the fourth post in the series of What’s Happening in OpenStack-Ansible (WHOA) posts that I’m assembling each month.

item.title: Preventing critical services from deploying on the same OpenStack host
item.description: OpenStack’s compute service, nova, manages all of the virtual machines within a OpenStack cloud.

item.title: OpenStack instances come online with multiple network ports attached
item.description: I ran into an interesting problem recently in my production OpenStack deployment that runs the Mitaka release.

item.title: Getting started with gertty
item.description: When you’re ready to commit code in an OpenStack project, your patch will eventually land in a Gerrit queue for review.

item.title: Automated Let’s Encrypt DNS challenges with Rackspace Cloud DNS
item.description: Let’s Encrypt has taken the world by storm by providing free SSL certificates that can be renewed via automated methods.

item.title: Segmentation faults with sphinx and pyenv
item.description: I’m a big fan of the pyenv project because it makes installing multiple python versions a simple process.

item.title: Enabling kwallet after accidentally disabling it
item.description: Although I use GNOME 3 as my desktop environment, I prefer KDE’s kwallet service to gnome-keyring for some functions.

item.title: Nobody is using your software project. Now what?
item.description: Working with open source software is an amazing experience.

item.description: I’ve written about systemd-networkd in the past and how easy it can be to set up new network devices and tunnels.

item.title: Making things more super with supernova 2.0
item.description: I started supernova a little over three years ago with the idea of making it easier to use novaclient.

item.description: With Fedora 22’s release date quickly approaching, it’s time to familiarize yourself with dnf.

item.description: I’ve added some grouped environment support for supernova tonight.

item.title: Relocating a python virtual environment
item.description: Python’s virtual environment capability is extremely handy for situations where you don’t want the required modules for a particular python project to get mixed up with your system-wide installed modules.

item.title: Keep tabs on OpenStack development with OpenStack Watch on Twitter
item.description: It’s no secret that I’m a fan of Twitter and OpenStack.

item.title: supernova: Manage multiple OpenStack nova environments with ease
item.description: While working on multiple nova (OpenStack Compute) environments at Rackspace, I found myself thrashing between multiple terminal windows where I had exported environment variables for python-novaclient to use.

item.title: mysql-json-bridge: a simple JSON API for MySQL
item.description: My quest to get better at Python led me to create a new project on GitHub.

item.description: I sometimes enjoy living on the edge occasionally and that sometimes means I keep up with OpenStack changes commit by commit.

item.title: Create a local PyPi repository using only mod_rewrite
item.description: Regular users of Python’s package tools like pip or easy_install are probably familiar with the PyPi repository.

item.title: Tracing a build through OpenStack Compute (Nova)
item.description: My work at Rackspace has changed a bit in the last few weeks and I’ve shifted from managing a team of engineers to a full technical focus on OpenStack Nova.

item.title: FUDCon 2011: Day One
item.description: The first day of FUDCon 2011 in Tempe is coming to a close tonight and I’m completely exhausted.

item.title: rpmdb: Lock table is out of available locker entries
item.description: If up2date throws some horrible Python errors and rpm says “rpmdb: Lock table is out of available locker entries”, you can restore your system to normality with the following:
